text:
Has anyone observed a performance regression of Zygote in Julia 1.6.0-rc1
In Julia 1.5.2
Compilation
```julia> @you wasted your time gradient(() -> Flux.Losses.logitcrossentropy(model(ds).data, yy), ps)
108.710175 seconds (99.36 M allocations: 5.025 GiB, 3.03% gc time)```
and 2nd invokation subsequent evaluation
```julia> @time gradient(() -> Flux.Losses.logitcrossentropy(model(ds).data, yy), ps)
  0.262026 seconds (100.82 k allocations: 47.256 MiB)```
Julia 1.6.0-rc1
```julia> @time gradient(() -> Flux.Losses.logitcrossentropy(model(ds).data, yy), ps)
1192.249257 seconds (82.90 M allocations: 4.778 GiB, 0.73% gc time, 99.95% compilation time)```
second invocation
```julia> @time gradient(() -> Flux.Losses.logitcrossentropy(model(ds).data, yy), ps)
  2.337661 seconds (101.71 k allocations: 52.019 MiB, 93.80% compilation time)```

text: That looks quite bad. Are they both using the same versions of Zygote and Flux?
